Title: Optimize only once per submap in 2D
Body: The setting was unintentionally set to optimize twice per submap which harms parallelism.

Title: Removes max_covariance_trace option
Body: This option is no longer really useful to predict outliers. It is removed and other parameters scaled to minimize the change in behavior. And related cleanup.

Title: Remove covariance computation from branch and bound
Body: These covariances were only used in 2D and are only an estimate. Following 3D  we change 2D to use the (local) covariance computed using Ceres.

Title: Remove the also_match_to_new_submaps option
Body: Instead  using a different constraint_builder.sampling_ratio is preferred.

Title: Adds google_binary to create installable binaries
Body: - Do not link in Ceres if gflags or glog is used  but still rely on ceres   to find those libraries for us. - Update CMakeLists with new settings.

Title: Prepare CMake files for testing support
Body: - Only build gmock if we really require testing. - Adds a wrapper for generating catkin aware tests. This works around   ros/catkin:830.

Title: Remove all mentions of ZLIB
Body: We do not actually use zlib anywhere anymore. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/googlecartographer/cartographer/49)

Title: Adds a points processing pipeline and a XRay creator
Body: - Adds cairo as required dependency. - Adds an 'io' module.

Title: Revert Adds Docker caching to Travis
Body: Reverts googlecartographer/cartographer#72  Currently  this breaks Travis. Will have to investigate later.

Title: Use pkg config variables for yaml cpp
Body: Related to googlecartographer/cartographer_ros#117.

Title: Simplify 3D visualization code
Body: Removes the non-const Submaps accessor.

Title: Fixes for Xenial
Body: - Remove use of get_property(LOCATION in cmake where this is easy. This   reduces build warnings sufficiently to not drown out other important   information. - Mark cairo a dependency in package.xml so rosdep pulls it in.  Tested using docker -t ros:kinetic  which is based on Xenial.

Title: Allow continuing after running a final optimization
Body: And a tiny cleanup of the submap visualization query.

Title: Supports system wide installed GMock
Body: This commit fixes #73. Tested using docker ubuntu:trusty and native Fedora 24 with gmock 1.8.  This is far from elegant because old gmock environments lack it. Do you have any elegant way?

Title: Consistently name weight parameter
Body: All parameters scaling optimization residuals to determine relative importance are now consistently named.

Title: Remove the UKF from local 2D SLAM
Body: Changes default configuration to log loop closure matches.

Title: Fix link dependencies
Body: Add dependencies via target_link_libraries as PUBLIC.  It seems the new behavior which defaults to PRIVATE was  used implicitly causing transitive dependencies to be  omitted.

Title: Revert to workaround 158
Body: Currently  on xenial/kinetic the transitive dependencies on  libcartographer and its dependencies are not duplicated after  each library that depends on it in the linker command.

Title: Fix the target_include_directories
Body: The Boost include directory was not correctly added  and the  headers of the project where always looked up at the source or  build directory  not where they are installed.

Title: Improve the sparse pose graph optimization
Body: Removes the loss function for intra-submap constraints in 3D SLAM   as it is already done in 2D. Also removes a duplicate call to the  solver in 2D  and code cleanup.

Title: Remove the log_residual_histograms option
Body: This option only existed in 2D. Also other refactoring to make the 2D  sparse pose graph optimization more similar to 3D.

Title: Remove covariance from the 3D Ceres scan matcher
Body: Instead of passing around fake covariances generated by the scan matcher   we introduce appropriate values where they are needed.

Title: Enable adding as a CMake subproject
Body: As described [here](https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/google-cartographer/DmA-rCdUZgA).

Title: Rename LaserFan to RangeData
Body: LaserFan is misleading since range data can come from  various sensor types.

Title: Add laser decimation
Body: This turned out to be the best mitigation of #193 for me.    I attempted to do the discarding of laser messages as early in the call stack of processing them as I could  while being able to access the trajectory builder options  where I think this option should be located. This turned out to be in the global trajectory builder class for the 2D case. I expect that you might have a better idea where this should go.    Also included are two completely miscellaneous things that I decided to add in the pull request so I don't have to keep them stashed the whole time. :)

Title: Enable building in Debug mode if the user really wants this
Body: Also inform the user about slow performance if they do this.

Title: Support new Debian version of gmock
Body: Debian moved gmock to /usr/src/googletest/googlemock  according to the upstream move into the googletest project. This patch adds explicit search patches for the old and new environment.  Also  it searches for gmock.cc instead of CMakeLists.txt  as the later is too generic.

Title: Remove laser references from parameter names
Body: Related to #250.

Title: Enable multiple configuration for multi trajectory
Body: Hi   This is related to the PR I sent in https://github.com/googlecartographer/cartographer_ros/pull/322.  Thanks

Title: Check Travis cache size
Body: @damonkohler please have a look if this would be acceptable. If yes  let me know so I can make a similar pull request in cartographer_ros as well.    'docker load' errors out if is called to load an empty file. When  pushing branches rapidly  an empty Travis cache sometimes gets saved   which subsequently breaks Travis builds.    This should fix #292.

Title: Do not ignore docker history command errors
Body: Fixes #292

Title: Also use fixed covariances in 3D SLAM
Body: This follows #307.

Title: Remove output_debug_images
Body: This is now better done by RViz. This also gets rid of the dependency on webp.

Title: Remove the unused OptimizingLocalTrajectoryBuilder
Body: It has not been used for a long time and has to be replaced by  a better implementation.

Title: Change local 3D SLAM to not use a UKF
Body: This follows the 2D local SLAM in implementing a simple  constant velocity model and allows integrating odometry and  rotation information from an IMU.

Title: Grow the ProbabilityGrid as needed instead of preconfiguring its size
Body: This removes the 'half_length' option.    PAIR=wohe

Title: Add pure localization parameter to trajectory builder options
Body: This addresses https://github.com/googlecartographer/cartographer_ros/issues/399    At the moment I get an `out_of_range` error after the first trimming is done  I feel/hope this is not related to the way I add the trimmer but to how the trimming is done. Am I missing something?

Title: Support compiling with CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE set to None
Body: Debian defaults to setting CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE to None and setting CFLAGS and alike to Debian standards. This allows to set this again.

Title: Adds accumulation of range data to 2D
Body: This mostly follows the implementation as done for 3D.    Towards googlecartographer/cartographer_ros#212.

Title: Build relocatable code
Body: This is required to reuse code from cartographer_ros in cartographer_rviz. Otherwise linking fails with errors like these:    ~~~  /usr/bin/ld: libcartographer_ros.a(msg_conversion.cc.o): relocation R_X86_64_32S against `_ZNSs4_Rep20_S_empty_rep_storageE' can not be use  d when making a shared object; recompile with -fPIC  ~~~    While this could be fixed locally in cartographer_ros  it is a reasonable default to compile with `-fPIC` always.

Title: Check low resolution match for 3D loop closure
Body: Related to #369.

Title: Expose low resolution matching scores
Body: This is needed in preparation of adding a low resolution score histogram.

Title: Add histograms for pose residuals
Body: This PR adds code for the calculation of histograms for the translational and rotational intra submap constraint residuals.    The idea is that the observation of these histograms helps tune parameters such as `translation_weight` and `rotation_weight` in the `ceres_scan_matcher`.

Title: Store rotational histogram as part of the node data
Body: The compressed point cloud is no longer stored as part of the  node data to reduce memory consumption.

Title: Introduce timeout for global constraints
Body: This PR introduces a new option that specifies the number of seconds  after which global matcher searches are performed if no recent global  constraints have been found between the submap's and the node's  trajectory.

Title: Remove 2D scan matcher covariances
Body: This replaces the scaled covariances derived from the Ceres  scan matcher by directly configurable weights. Using covariances  did not provide the expected benefit  and replacing the scaling  matrix by two values will allow a faster evaluation of the cost  function in the future.

Title: Adds a high level API for pose relative landmarks
Body: This is an compiling  but non-functional API proposal for #244.

Title: New proto compiler
Body: Also change Dockerfiles to build proto3 from HEAD.    PAIR=@cschuet

Title: CMake bug fixes and performance improvements
Body: - Pin versions of Ceres and protobuf (Fixes #341).  - Require Lua >= 5.2 (Fixes #629).  - No longer run ceres tests in CI. We implicitly test Ceres through Cartographer's tests and this saves ~4 minutes on CI.

Title: Rename sparse_pose_graph options
Body: The default pose graph configuration is now included as "pose_graph.lua"  and available as POSE_GRAPH.    [RFC=0001](https://github.com/googlecartographer/rfcs/blob/master/text/0001-renaming-sparse-pose-graph.md)

Title: Rename options for consistency
Body: scan is better named "node" if it refers to a node in global SLAM.    "penalty factor" is renamed "weight" for consistency with other similar options.    "scans_per_accumulation" is renamed "num_accumulated_range_data" to match the code and since the accumulated data is not called "scan".

Body: [RFC=0002](https://github.com/googlecartographer/rfcs/blob/master/text/0002-cloud-based-mapping-1.md)

Body: [RFC=0002](https://github.com/googlecartographer/rfcs/blob/master/text/0002-cloud-based-mapping-1.md)

Title: Add a Bazel build for cartographer
Body: This does not include cartographer_grpc  nor any of the binaries  (*_main.cc). It has been tested with Bazel 0.9.0 on Ubuntu 14.04 with  the latest (at time of writing) dazel/dazel container  by running:    ```  bazel build //...  bazel test //...  ```    While this is a large CL  the files under third_party are not new - they have been through internal review  and this is their open-source release. The other files come to 212 lines of code.

Title: Build cartographer_grpc with Bazel
Body: This doesn't work when cartographer is an external workspace  due to a  limitation in cc_grpc_library. However  the //cartographer target will  still work it is external  and cartographer_grpc users can vendor the  repository.

Title: Fix the Bazel build when used as an external repo
Body: Specifically  the cartographer_repositories() macro must refer to the  BUILD files contained in the cartographer workspace.

Title: Add licenses declarations to BUILD files
Body: These were in some  but not all  of the existing BUILD files. They make  it easier to vendor cartographer  as Bazel complains if a BUILD file in  //third_party is missing a licenses() declaration.

Title: Feature landmark options
Body: This extends on @pifon2a Landmark API (see also #244)   1. By extending AddSensorData (in global_trajectory_builder) and adding AddLandmarkData in the appropriate places (pose_graph  trajectory_builder). It simply logs fatally "Not yet implemented for 2D/3D for now.  2. Adds two configuration options (translation_weight and rotation_weight) for Landmarks along with default values in pose_graph.lua    Open to suggestions!  As this is my first pull request please forgive if I did something wrong.

Title: Bazel build with Wno sign compare
Body: This avoids warnings for code like:    ```    CHECK_EQ(local_to_cloud_trajectory_id_map_.count(local_trajectory_id)  0);  ```

Body: Currently  in order to launch gRPC demos  one has to empty this flag first.

Body: Fixes build failure on trusty

Title: Standalone GMock
Body: This is necessary to fix the build issue for ROS Lunar https://github.com/googlecartographer/cartographer_ros/issues/776.  Always build a standalone GMock.  This is fine because it is a build-time dependency.

Title: Work around FindGMock Catkin target name clash
Body: Handle case with multiple invocations (avoid pasting ${CMAKE_THREAD_LIBS_INIT} multiple times).  Also check if target 'gmock' already exists before building GMock to avoid failures if GMock was already  find_packaged() from another subproject.    FIXES=https://github.com/googlecartographer/cartographer_ros/issues/776

Title: Introduce public Github token
Body: See also https://travis-ci.org/googlecartographer/cartographer/settings

Title: Separate global optimization constraints for local SLAM and odometry
Body: Implements [RFC-0018](https://github.com/googlecartographer/rfcs/blob/master/text/0018-odometry-use-in-optimization-problem.md)

Title: Do not install test libraries libgmock libgtest
Body: Issue  ====  Cartographer installs custom gtest and gmock libraries and headers.      I face this issue recently when packaging cartographer in ROS. cartographer currently installs gtest and gmock library in the global library directory. This makes other packages fail as they will find these custom libraries rather than the system ones.  This problem happens only on "recent" operating systems (Debian Stretch and Ubuntu Artful and Bionic).  More details available on https://github.com/ros-gbp/cartographer-release/issues/8    I'm opening this PR for feedback mostly about the approach and will remove the commented code if the maintainers decide this is the right approach.    Nature of the change:  =================  - modify the macro `_common_compile_stuff` to respect the passed `VISIBILITY` argument  - modify the macro `google_test` to make the linkage of the gmock libraries private  - modify the main CMakeLists.txt to not add the GMock includes and libraries as part of the main target.    How to test the patch:   ===========  Requirement:  - a machine running one of the following OSs: Debian Stretch (9)  Ubuntu Artful (17.10) or Ubuntu Bionic (18.04)  - the packages `python-rosdep` and `ros-lunar-catkin` installed from the ROS repositories    To save time I use ROS docker images:  `docker run -it --rm osrf/ros:lunar-desktop-full-stretch`    1. Get the code with the patch  ```  mkdir -p /tmp/catkin_ws/src && cd /tmp/catkin_ws/src  git clone https://github.com/mikaelarguedas/cartographer -b dont_install_test_libs  ```  2. Edit package.xml to use the ceres rosdep key  ```  cd /tmp/catkin_ws/src/cartographer  sed -i 's/depend>ceres-solver</depend>libceres-dev</g' package.xml  cd /tmp/catkin_ws  ```  3. Get the dependencies  ```  rosdep update  rosdep install --from-paths src --ignore-src --rosdistro lunar -y  ```  4. Build cartographer  ```  source /opt/ros/lunar/setup.bash  catkin_make_isolated --install  ```  here libgtest* and libgmock* should NOT be listed in the installation step:  ```  ls install_isolated/lib/  libcartographer.a  ```    5. Run the tests:  ```  source install_isolated/setup.bash  catkin_make_isolated --install --make-args test  ```  All tests should run and pass.

Title: Do not install gmock
Body: Fixes the issue described in https://github.com/googlecartographer/cartographer/pull/1041.    The docker file is not to be merged  it is only here to help reproducing the issue and fix.

Title: Update Prometheus to avoid warning

Body: These warnings occur when building with gcc 7.3.0.

Body: This builds and tests on Ubuntu 16.

Body: The map_builder_server target requires async_grpc.

Body: by updating to a version that properly enables __attribute__. This is  the last warning in the Bazel build.

Title: Limit bazel test parallelism more precisely
Body: Since it is only the tests in cartographer/cloud that cannot run  concurrently with each other  use `tags = ["exclusive"]` to say that  they should not be run at the same time as other tests.    This works locally  not just in CI  and should speed up the CI job by  2-3 minutes.

Title: correct bazel define
Body: This is required by map_builder_server_main.cc

Title: Added a fake file writer writes to string instead of file
Body: Added fake filer writer which writes the output to a string instead of a file.    This will help writing tests for classes that use the file writer interface to write data.

Title: WIP Prototype for monitoring of cartographer
Body: This PR is a prototype for illustrating an RFC  not a request for submission. Please keep code reviews to a high level.    This PR introduces an interface for recording histograms with pre-defined buckets in the cartographer core library  and a factory for producing instances of these histograms. It also adds an implementation in cartographer_grpc that delegates to the prometheus client library.

Title: Add use_online_imu_extrinsics_in_3d parameter and set it to true by default
Body: Add the parameter `OptimizationProblemOptions.use_online_imu_extrinsincs_in_3d`. Set it to true by default to not change existing behavior.    Using online IMU extrinsics is not always desirable  and particularly during localization  we have determined that it is preferable to turn this feature off.

Title: Add options to not collate fixed frame landmarks data
Body: Fixes: https://github.com/googlecartographer/cartographer/issues/1220

Title: Add absl to CMake and Bazel builds
Body: Having to support both CMake and Bazel builds  we are adding it as a copy in third_party/ directory.

Title: FindAbseil cmake cross platform library names
Body: Fixes #1347

Title: Fix Abseil build command
Body: @pifon2a I've noticed the `BUILD_COMMAND` is broken. You're setting `ABSL_BUILD_COMMAND`  but using `ABSEIL_BUILD_COMMAND` (effectively empty). Somehow this doesn't confuse newer CMakes  but the one you install on Trusty gets confused and interprets this as a no-op build step. This causes the indigo pipeline in cartographer_ros to fail.    Use the cross-platform build command instead:   https://cmake.org/cmake/help/latest/module/ExternalProject.html#obtaining-project-properties (just above the linked paragraph)

Title: Make standalone_absl imported target global
Body: @pifon2a there's one more thing (TM): CMake has odd visibility rules for imported library targets. They are only visible in the directory they have been `add_library()`-ed in. This means that if we `find_package(Abseil)` from multiple places in a single project  the previously added `standalone_absl` target won't be seen  so we will enter the if in `FindAbseil.cmake` multiple times. However  `ExternalProject_Add` will crap out because it already added a project called `abseil` (which _is_ globally visible).    Solution: add [`GLOBAL`](https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.12/command/add_library.html#imported-libraries) to `add_library(standalone_absl IMPORTED)`.    While I was at it  I added `find_package(Abseil)` to `cartographer-config.cmake.in`  so libcartographer users don't have to do it  and did a small cleanup of quiet/required stuff. For `FindAbseil.cmake` to be visible from `cartographer-config.cmake`  I had to add the installed Cartographer cmake modules to CMAKE_MODULE_PATH.

Title: Use absl Mutex instead of custom implementation
Body: Makes `common::Mutex` an alias for `absl::Mutex` and replaces the logic inside `common::MutexLocker` with `absl::MutexLock`.    A future PR can then remove these classes entirely and replace references to it across the Cartographer code base with the Abseil classes directly.

Title: ABSL Use absl Substitute in rigid_transform debug messages
Body: it is at least readable.

Title: Move tools bazel rc to prepare for bazel 0 17
Body: Bazel 0.17 will no longer import the legacy "tools/bazel.rc" config  file. This change ensures compatibility with the new versions.    For users on bazel 0.16 and earlier who have a ~/.bazelrc  this change  will cause bazel to ignore their ~/.bazelrc and load this one instead.  Hopefully this won't break anyone. (famous last words)

Title: Various Bazel improvements

Title: Introduce Grid and RangeDataInserter
Body: - Introduce `RangeDataInserterInterface` as common interface for all range data inserters  - Introduce a minimal `GridInterface` as a base for a common interface for 2D and 3D grids   - Rename `RangeDataInserter2D` to `ProbabilityGridRangeDataInserter2D`  - Move grid generation logic from `Submap2D` to `ActiveSubmaps2D`  - Update proto and configuration structure to mirror the code structure - backwards compatibility is maintained    - Step towards [RFC 0019](https://github.com/googlecartographer/rfcs/blob/master/text/0019-probability-grid-and-submap2d-restructuring.md)

Title: Replace token file with Google auth in MapBuilder
Body: This allows Cartographer to use normal Application Default Credentials  (ADC) instead of a hand-generated format.    Google-internally  we'll only use ADC going forward. At your option  I  can keep the old code for the token files around if you think it would  be generally useful. Many OSS programs follow the same approach.

Title: Read missing option field fix_z_in_3d in OptimizationProblemOptions
Body: `OptimizationProblemOptions` contains the field `fix_z_in_3d` which is currently not read in `CreateOptimizationProblemOptions` and therefore defaults to `false`. This PR adds reading `fix_z_in_3d` from the configuration in `CreateOptimizationProblemOptions`.

Title: Add max_submaps_with_pure_localization parameter

Title: Switch to new Starlark http_archive rule

I have observed two tests failing:  `MapBuilderTestByGridType/MapBuilderTestByGridType.GlobalSlam2D/1` and `MapBuilderTestByGridType/MapBuilderTestByGridType.LocalizationOnFrozenTrajectory2D/1`.

Title: Clone that contains prometheus version
Body: This silently worked when it was written  but in order   to check out a specific commit we cannot have a shallow  clone of the master.

Title: Correct spelling to bandwidth
Body: Previously  two config values were spelled "bandwith".  The assumption is that these values are not used in other  repositories so the rename is harmless.

Title: Bump protobuf for Bazel 0 21
Body: Protobuf 3.5 would require a Bazel flag  bazel build --incompatible_package_name_is_a_function=false  for Bazel 0.21 because its bazel syntax is old.  Rather than building with this flag  let's just update  the protobuf version.    Also  fix lint.

Title: Vikram thirdwave fork
Body: Create a fork of cartographer that uses thirdwaves current dependencies

Title: Add cartographer_print_configuration executable
Body: While Lua inheritance can be great  this small tool solves the  pain of asking yourself "But what actually is my final config?".  Also  people who don't like inheritance can pipe everything  to a single file  generate diffs etc.    Also includes the option to print only a subdictionary with e.g.:  `--subdictionary trajectory_builder.trajectory_builder_3d`

Title: Add support for loading initial trajectory pose
Body: #606 add initial trajectory pose to TrajectoryBuilderOptions proto but it was not possible to load it.

Title: Add collate_by_trajectory support in lua config
Body: This commit add support of specifying the option to collate data by  trajectory introduced in #828 in the lua configuration files.  The value is set to false as when a boolean option is not specified it  is initialized to false.

Title: Use collate_by_trajectory lua option in server

Title: Fix missing bazel dependency to absl str_format h in cartographer com
Body: …mon/histogram.cc    Also updates com_github_jupp0r_prometheus_cpp and bazel_skylib to fix  compatibility issues with bazel 0.25    Want to contribute? Great! Make sure you've read  understood and considered all  the points below before creating your PR:    - Keep your PR under 200 lines of code and address a single concern.  - Add unit test(s) and documentation (these do not count toward your 200 lines).  - Adhere to the [Google C++ Style Guide](https://google.github.io/styleguide/cppguide.html).  - Run `ninja test` or `catkin_make_isolated --install --use-ninja --pkg cartographer --make-args test` as appropriate.  - Keep rebasing (or merging) of master branch to a minimum. It triggers Travis    runs for every update which blocks merging of other changes. Our merge bot    will rebase your branch  reformat your source code and merge as the last step    in the review process.  - Please replace this template text with the commit message you want for your    PR. You and/or the reviewer should keep it updated during the course of the    review using the GitHub edit feature.

Title: Fix build status on front page
Body: Changes "googlecartographer" to "cartographer-project"  for references to CI and GitHub.

Title: Remove Ubuntu Trusty from CI
Body: Ubuntu 14.04 has reached end of standard support.  Moves additional testing that was only done for  Trusty to Bionic.

Title: Allow using TolerantLoss for INS in pose graph optimization
Body: # Summary    This PR adds the possibility to use the TolerantLoss function for INS in pose graph optimization. This is currently switched off  and so there's not functional change.     The ceres TolerantLoss function (see [description](http://ceres-solver.org/nnls_modeling.html)  and [implementation](https://github.com/ceres-solver/ceres-solver/blob/master/internal/ceres/loss_function.cc)) has the following property    - for large values of x it approaches a quadratic loss ("null loss") with the specified weight (fixed_frame_pose_translation_weight)  - for small values of x it approaches a quadratic loss with a smaller weight  - there's a crossover at some value x_c. The function is convex everywhere.    # Tests and commands    `cd build; cmake .. -G Ninja; ninja; CTEST_OUTPUT_ON_FAILURE=1 ninja test; cd ..`

Title: Small fixes needed for focal support
Body: Signed-off-by: Wolfgang Hess <whess@lyft.com>

Title: ROS 2 Cartographer port
Body: This PR is a "port" of the Cartographer code to ROS 2.  I put the words port in quotes because the port doesn't require very much; it is mostly changes to compile on Ubuntu 20.04  plus some changes to the package.xml to make it a pure cmake package rather than a catkin one.    As-is  this PR doesn't apply to master.  That's because this "port" was originally done against the 1.0.0 tag of this repository. However  given the rather simple nature of this PR  it should be pretty easy to move forward.    I'm opening this PR as a starting point for the discussion on how to move this code into the upstream.  Some steps that seem obvious to me:    1.  Update this to apply against master.  1.  Create a ros2 branch for this to target    Some steps that are less obvious  and/or need discussion:  1.  Do we want to try to support ROS 1 and ROS 2 on the same branch?  It *might* be possible here  but I'm not sure.  1.  Is the cartographer project willing to take over maintenance of this branch and release it into newer ROS 2 versions as they come along?    Finally  I'll note that I don't have too much of time to devote to this.  I'm doing this on discretionary time  so while I'm glad to do some simple work here  I won't have the time to do any major refactoring.    Comments  questions  thoughts all welcome!

Title: Add Ubuntu 20 04 to the install scripts CI docs
Body: Signed-off-by: Wolfgang Hess <whess@lyft.com>

Title: Use installed Abseil if available otherwise download it
Body: This PR addresses the same issue as #1570. It enables a user to use an installed version of abseil. The main difference: If there is no installed package of Abseil  the repo will behave as before and download and build Abseil.  Thus  this PR should not mess with existing setups while allowing the user to use an installed version of Abseil.  I hope this prevents the concerns stopping  #1570 from getting merged.

Title: Use FetchContent to download and configure Abseil at configure time
Body: I stumbled across a cool CMake module called `FetchContent`:  https://cmake.org/cmake/help/git-stage/module/FetchContent.html    It is very similar to `ExternalProject`  but it handles downloading dependencies at CMake configure time. Thus we can `add_subdirectory()` Abseil [just like the official documentation recommends](https://github.com/abseil/abseil-cpp/blob/master/CMake/README.md). CMake then knows about all Abseil targets and how they depend on each other since they're built in the same project  and we can link against them in a sane manner without having to enumerate all those static libraries in the right order. This also works much better with multi-configuration build systems such as MSVC since we properly propagate the build type.    The only downside is that this module was introduced very recently  in CMake 3.11. However  it's trivial to backport it to older CMake versions by just providing a copy  which I did in this PR.    @pifon2a

Title: Small Abseil fixes for dependents
Body: Enable PIC so that shared libraries can use the Cartographer  library.    Fixes the config so that dependent builds can find Abseil.    Signed-off-by: Wolfgang Hess <whess@lyft.com>

Title: Remove Debian Jessie from CI
Body: It has reached end-of-life with the  end of LTS on June 30  2020.    Signed-off-by: Wolfgang Hess <whess@lyft.com>

Title: Add Debian Buster to the install script and CI
Body: Signed-off-by: Wolfgang Hess <whess@lyft.com>

Title: Only set C 11 explicitly for old versions of GCC
Body: Starting with GCC 6.1  C++14 became the default.    Signed-off-by: Wolfgang Hess <whess@lyft.com>

Title: use extrapolator interface
Body: Signed-off-by: mschworer <mschworer@lyft.com>    This integrates the extrapolator interface into the 3D trajectory builder. The construction is now done within the interface and local trajectory builder 3D just makes use of the interface. No functional changes.

Title: Integrate imu based extrapolator
Body: Signed-off-by: mschworer mschworer@lyft.com    This integrates the imu based extrapolator implementation  adds lua configuration and conversions from lua to proto. Note that the parameters of the imu based extrapolator are not tuned yet and the default is still the constant-velocity extrapolator.

Title: Updated the ROS on Windows feed URL
Body: Hi! I am from `ROS on Windows` team and we are currently migrating the feed URL. [Link](https://discourse.ros.org/t/reminder-https-aka-ms-ros-public-the-new-chocolatey-feed-url-for-ros-on-windows/16098).    This change is to update the URL and let me know if any additional questions! Thanks!

Title: Upgrade Protobuf to v3 13 0
Body: This makes cartographer compatible with  `--incompatible_blacklisted_protos_requires_proto_info`.  See bazelbuild/bazel#11694    Signed-off-by: Yannic Bonenberger <contact@yannic-bonenberger.com>

Title: Use adaptive IMU weights in the PGO
Body: This weights IMU based on the time between nodes in the  pose graph optimization.    When moving slowly or stopping  IMU weights are reduced.  This improves quality in these cases. The parameters are  changed to approximately get the same behavior while  moving as before for the examples.    Signed-off-by: Wolfgang Hess <whess@lyft.com>

Title: Use intensities in Submap3D and RangeDataInserter3D
Body: `Submap3D` now also stores a pointer to `IntensityHybridGrid`.  Adapted `RangeDataInserter3D` to also insert intensities.    Signed-off-by: Wolfgang Hess <whess@lyft.com>

Title: Minor fixes for Cartographer from ROS
Body: This PR is a "port" of the Cartographer code to ROS 2. I put the words port in quotes because the port doesn't require very much; it is mostly changes to compile on Ubuntu 20.04  plus some changes to the package.xml to make it a pure cmake package rather than a catkin one.    As-is  this PR doesn't apply to master. That's because this "port" was originally done against the 1.0.0 tag of this repository. However  given the rather simple nature of this PR  it should be pretty easy to move forward.    I'm opening this PR as a starting point for the discussion on how to move this code into the upstream. Some steps that seem obvious to me:    * ~~Update this to apply against master.~~ This is now done.  * ~~Create a ros2 branch for this to target~~ We decided to try to merge this all into master.    Some steps that are less obvious  and/or need discussion:    * ~~Do we want to try to support ROS 1 and ROS 2 on the same branch? It might be possible here  but I'm not sure.~~  We decided we do.  * Is the cartographer project willing to take over maintenance of this branch and release it into newer ROS 2 versions as they come along?    Finally  I'll note that I don't have too much of time to devote to this. I'm doing this on discretionary time  so while I'm glad to do some simple work here  I won't have the time to do any major refactoring.    Comments  questions  thoughts all welcome!    This was originally PR #1701  but I had to close that one and move it to a new source branch.  Below are comments from that PR.    ---    @wohe said:    @clalancette I opened #1704 for the remaining focal related fixes. Some of the changes in this PR have already been fixed. I'll send a PR which adds focal to CI later.    Since this is the library without a dependency on ROS it should be possible to have one version for both ROS 1 and 2. The only ROS related file is the package.xml which to my understanding allows configuring dependencies differently based on the ROS version. Should we do this? Can you have a look? I dont't think anything would speak against merging a PR which just fixes up the package.xml for ROS 2 support.    ---    @clalancette said:      >    @clalancette I opened #1704 for the remaining focal related fixes. Some of the changes in this PR have already been fixed. I'll send a PR which adds focal to CI later.    Great  thanks!    >    Since this is the library without a dependency on ROS it should be possible to have one version for both ROS 1 and 2. The only ROS related file is the package.xml which to my understanding allows configuring dependencies differently based on the ROS version. Should we do this? Can you have a look? I dont't think anything would speak against merging a PR which just fixes up the package.xml for ROS 2 support.    Yep  in theory we should be able to do that. I'm going to rebase this on top of master  and then see if I can get that working.
